title: Our Best Carrot Recipes from Fresh Salads to Decadent Cake
text:
Carrots, from their lush (and edible) green tops to their orange (or white, yellow, purple) roots, are not only visually appealing but also rich in essential nutrients that can benefit your overall well-being.
As their name suggests, carrots are abundant in plant compounds called carotenoids. These pigments not only give carrots their characteristic color but also play a crucial role in maintaining healthy eyesight. The age-old adage of eating carrots for better vision isn’t just an old wives’ tale! Carotenoids, particularly beta-carotene, lutein and zeaxanthin, are known to support eye health by protecting against age-related macular degeneration and cataracts.
Whether you prefer to munch on them raw, roast them to caramelized perfection or bake them into cakes, carrots retain their carotenoid content through various cooking methods. Adding a touch of fat or oil to your carrot-based dishes can enhance nutrient absorption, ensuring that you reap the maximum benefits from these colorful root vegetables.
Looking for inspiration to incorporate more carrots into your diet? Below are 9 ways to enjoy these root vegetables at any time of day — yes, even in desserts!
Crispy Carrot Tacos (Tacos Dorados de Zanahoria)
These are deceptively easy and don’t need much beyond raw carrots and salt. You’ll need toothpicks to secure them closed while cooking.
Honey Sesame Carrot Salad
Instead of roasting the carrots, let their natural crunch and flavor shine in this raw salad.
Recipe from Edible San Diego
Tip-to-Top Barbeque Maple Glazed Carrots with Carrot Top Salsa Verde
As the name suggests, this recipe uses the entire carrot — from tip to top — and can be served as a starter, main course or side dish.
Recipe from Edible Rhody
Carrot Cake Breakfast Cookies
If you love the exterior crunch, do not seal the cookies in an airtight container or they will get soft. Keep the lid ajar!
Recipe from Edible Bozeman
Carrot Lox
Marinated in a savory blend of tamari, liquid smoke and nori, the thinly sliced carrots develop a rich, smoky flavor reminiscent of lox.
Recipe from Edible Ottawa
Roasted Carrot Ginger Soup
You stir in the ginger at the end of cooking, so you can adjust the amount to your spice level.
Recipe from Edible Jersey
Carrots with Mint Caper Tapenade
The roasted carrots rest on a bright green bed of fresh tapenade made with four simple ingredients: mint, capers, walnuts and olive oil. This dish can be served warm or at room temperature.
Recipe from Edible Monterey Bay
Carrot Mustard Cake
Don’t knock it ’til you try it. This cake pairs well with an equally unique Mustard, Honey & Fennel Ice Cream.
Recipe from Edible East Bay
Carrot Salad with Spices & Pistachios
When it comes to using carrots in a salad, we often think about grating them to add crunch and color. This recipe takes a completely different direction as the carrots are steamed instead and served cold.
Recipe from Edible Boston
